funding_program: Coastal and Marine Habitat Restoration Grants (NOAA)
administrative_organization: NOAA Restoration Center
program_description: This funding supports projects that promote productive and sustainable fisheries, improve the recovery and conservation of protected resources, and promote healthy ecosystems and resilient communities through the restoration of coastal habitat.  Applicants may submit one or more projects to be completed in one, two, or three years.
eligible_projects_description: See NOAA website for funding details as project funding is often tied to specific project purpose(s).
match_requirement_description: Non-federal match, recommended 1:1.
funding_limitation_description: Up to $4M over a three year cooperative agreement.
additional_application: Application dates are estimates at this time, pending appropriations.

funding_program: 319 Grants -- Water Quality (Ecology)
administrative_organization: Washington State Department of Ecology
program_description: The 319 grant program provides funding for nonpoint source pollution projects to improve and protect water quality.
eligible_projects_description: n/a
match_requirement_description: n/a
funding_limitation_description: $250K grant limit with in-kind match contribution;  $500K grant limit with cash-only match contribution.
additional_application: Apply via the annual Water Quality Combined Funding Cycle process.

funding_program: Aquatic Invasive Plant Management Grant Program (Ecology)
administrative_organization: Washington State Department of Ecology
program_description: The Aquatic Invasive Plant Management grant program provides financial and technical support for the eradication and control of invasive, non-native aquatic plants that threaten the health of lakes, rivers, and streams.
eligible_projects_description: n/a
match_requirement_description: n/a
funding_limitation_description: $30K for planning grants, and $75K for implementation grants.  Each applicant is limited to $75K per annual grant cycle.  Early infestation projects are limited to $50K per project.

funding_program: Centennial Grants -- Water Quality (Ecology)
administrative_organization: Washington State Department of Ecology
program_description: The Centennial grant program provides funding for water quality infrastructure and nonpoint source pollution projects to improve and protect water quality.
eligible_projects_description: n/a
match_requirement_description: n/a
funding_limitation_description: $250K grant limit with in-kind match contribution;  $500K grant limit with cash-only match contribution.
additional_application: Apply via the annual Water Quality Combined Funding Cycle process.

funding_program: Clean Water State Revolving Loan Fund -- Water Quality (Ecology)
administrative_organization: Washington State Department of Ecology
program_description: The Clean Water State Revolving Fund provides low interest and forgivable principal loan funding for wastewater treatment construction projects, eligible nonpoint source pollution control projects, on-site septic system replacement and eligible green projects.
eligible_projects_description: n/a
match_requirement_description: n/a
funding_limitation_description: No more than 50% available funds can go to any one project.

funding_program: Freshwater Algae Program (Ecology)
administrative_organization: Washington State Department of Ecology
program_description: The Freshwater Algae Program provides funding to manage or control of algae in water bodies that have had toxic algae blooms within the last three years.
eligible_projects_description: n/a
match_requirement_description: n/a
funding_limitation_description: n/a

funding_program: Stormwater Financial Assistance Program -- Water Quality (Ecology)
administrative_organization: Washington State Department of Ecology
program_description: The Stormwater Financial Assistance Program provides grants for stormwater projects that address existing pollution problems and meet the definition of retrofit or source control activities that enhance existing stormwater programs.
eligible_projects_description: n/a
match_requirement_description: 25%  for non-hardship communities.  15% for hardship communities.
funding_limitation_description: $5M per funding cycle per community.

funding_program: Water Quality (Ecology)
administrative_organization: Washington State Department of Ecology
program_description: The 319 grant program provides funding for nonpoint source pollution projects to improve and protect water quality.
eligible_projects_description: n/a
match_requirement_description: n/a
funding_limitation_description: $250K grant limit with in-kind match contribution;  $500K grant limit with cash-only match contribution.
additional_application: Apply via the annual Water Quality Combined Funding Cycle process.

funding_program: Family Forest Fish Passage Program (WA State)
administrative_organization: Washington State Recreation and Conservation Office, Washington State Department of Fish and Wildlife, and Washington State Department of Natural Resources
program_description: This program provides assistance to small forest landowners to fix inadequate or blocked culverts on logging roads in order for salmon to access streams.
eligible_projects_description: n/a
match_requirement_description: n/a
funding_limitation_description: n/a

funding_program: Salmon Recovery Funding Board (RCO)
administrative_organization: Washington State Recreation and Conservation Office
program_description: Salmon recovery grants are awarded by the Salmon Recovery Funding Board to protect and restore salmon habitat and implement salmon recovery plans.
eligible_projects_description: Planning, acquisition and restoration projects intended to implement salmon recovery plans.
administrative_sub: Washington State Salmon Recovery Regions and Lead Entities
match_requirement_description: Match may include cash, bond funds, grants (unless prohibited by the funding entity), labor, equipment and equipment use, materials, staff time, and donations.
funding_limitation_description: Minimum $5K application.
additional_application: Feb-June 30 pre-application, Feb-July site visits, Aug app due, Dec grants funded.

funding_program: National Coastal Wetlands Conservation Grant Program (Ecology)
administrative_organization: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service
program_description: This funding program provides grants to acquire, restore, and enhance wetlands of the U.S. coastal states and territories.
eligible_projects_description: Acquisition, restoration, or enhancement of coastal wetlands.
administrative_sub: Washington State Department of Ecology (Shorelands  and Environmental Assistance Program)
match_requirement_description: Minimum 25% non-federal match with additional points awarded for increased match.
funding_limitation_description: $1M maximum federal award.
additional_application: Application dates are estimates at this time, pending publication of federal Notice of Funding Opportunity.
supplemental_information: State agencies only, however, Ecology will partner with Tribes, non-governmental organizations, local governments, and others as subgrantees for funds awarded.

funding_program: Terry Husseman Account, Coastal Protection fund (Ecology)
administrative_organization: Washington State Department of Ecology
program_description: Terry Husseman Account grants support locally sponsored projects to restore or enhance the natural environment.  Typical projects address water quality issues and fish and wildlife habitat protection or enhancement in or adjacent to waters of the state, i.e., streams, lakes, wetlands or the ocean.
eligible_projects_description: Additional Eligible Project Types: Fish and Wildlife habitat enhancement; Livestock Exclusion Fencing; Low Impact Development (LID); Stream bank Stabilization.
match_requirement_description: n/a
funding_limitation_description: Awards can be up to a maximum of $50M. The typical grant award is less than $20M.
additional_application: Apply via the annual Terry Husseman Account Funding Cycle process

funding_program: Aquatic Lands Enhancement Account
administrative_organization: Washington State Recreation and Conservation Office
program_description: Funding supports the acquisition, improvement, or protection of aquatic lands for public purpose; for providing and improving access to such lands.
eligible_projects_description: Development or renovation, land acquisition, restoration
match_requirement_description: Applicants must contribute matching resources at least equal to the amount of the grant requested. Applicants must provide a minimum of 10 percent of the total cost of a project in the form of a local contribution, not from a state or federal source. This policy does not apply to Native American tribes
funding_limitation_description:
Combination project (acquisition with either development or restoration)
$1 million, not more than $500,000 may be for development or restoration costs; Combination project (development and restoration)
$500,000

funding_program: Boating Infrastructure Grant - Tier1
administrative_organization: Washington State Recreation and Conservation Office
program_description: Funding supports development and renovation of boating facilities targeting transient recreational boats 26 feet and larger.
eligible_projects_description: Development and renovation, education; Maintenance;
administrative_sub: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, U.S. Department of Interior
match_requirement_description: 25 %. Projects with a match higher than 25 % will receive additional points during evaluation; Except for state agencies and Native American tribes, at least 10 percent of the total project cost must be provided in the form of a non-state, non-federal contribution.
funding_limitation_description: An applicant may request a grant of at least $5,000 and not more than $192,086 per project.
additional_application: Application dates are estimates at this time, pending publication of federal Notice of Funding Opportunity.
supplemental_information: Transient means travel to a single facility for day use or staying at a single facility for up to 15 days.

funding_program: Boating Infrastructure Grant - Tier2
administrative_organization: Washington State Recreation and Conservation Office
program_description: Funding supports development and renovation of boating facilities targeting transient recreational boats 26 feet and larger.
eligible_projects_description: Development and renovation, education; Maintenance with development or restoration;
administrative_sub: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service, U.S. Department of Interior
match_requirement_description: 25 %. Projects with a match higher than 25 % will receive additional points during evaluation; Except for state agencies and Native American tribes, at least 10 percent of the total project cost must be provided in the form of a non-state, non-federal contribution.
funding_limitation_description: An applicant may request a grant of at least $200,001 and not more than $1,440,645 per project.
additional_application: Application dates are estimates at this time, pending publication of federal Notice of Funding Opportunity.
supplemental_information: Transient means travel to a single facility for day use or staying at a single facility for up to 15 days.

funding_program: Washington Wildlife and Recreation Program - Water Access Category
administrative_organization: Washington State Recreation and Conservation Office
program_description: Funding supports acquisition and development of recreation lands.
eligible_projects_description:
Acquisition,
Development or renovation,
Combination of acquisition and development or renovation
match_requirement_description: Exceptions: Match may be reduced for communities in need, underserved populations, counties in need, or communities providing facilities in federal disaster areas.
funding_limitation_description: n/a

funding_program: Boating Facilities Program - Local
administrative_organization: Washington State Recreation and Conservation Office
program_description: Funding supports acquisition, development , and planning of areas for motorized recreational boating facilities and support elements on fresh or salt water.
eligible_projects_description: Development or renovation, land acquisition, planning
match_requirement_description: Local agencies and Native American tribes must pay at least 25 percent of a project’s cost. In addition, local agencies must contribute at least 10 percent of the total project cost in the form of a non-state, non-federal contribution.

funding_program: Boating Facilities Program - State
administrative_organization: Washington State Recreation and Conservation Office
program_description: Funding supports acquisition, development , and planning of areas for motorized recreational boating facilities and support elements on fresh or salt water.
eligible_projects_description: Development or renovation, land acquisition, planning
match_requirement_description: State agencies do not need to provide a match.
funding_limitation_description: The total of all BFP dollars requested by any single state agency may not exceed twice that estimated by the Recreation and Conservation Funding Board to be available for state agencies in a grant cycle.

funding_program: Firearms and Archery Range Recreation Program
administrative_organization: Washington State Recreation and Conservation Office
program_description: Funding supports acquisition, development, renovation of firearm and archery range recreational facilities for increased public access to ranges.
eligible_projects_description: Land acquisition, Development or renovation, combination (acquisition and development/renovation)
percent_match:
50% for local agencies;
33 % for local agencies’ noise abatement or safety improvement projects (existing range facilities only); No match required for state agencies
match_requirement_description:
33 % match for noise abatement or safety improvement projects or project elements (existing range facilities only).
50 % match for all other projects or project elements.
Locals and nonprofits – At least 10 percent of the total project cost must be provided in the form of a non-state, non-federal contribution.
funding_limitation_description: While an applicant may submit more than one application, RCO’s contribution to any single project will not exceed $150,000.

funding_program: Land and Water Conservation Fund
administrative_organization: Washington State Recreation and Conservation Office
program_description: Funding supports acquisition, development and renovation for public outdoor recreation and funds may be used for open space, forest, wildlife areas, beaches, and water access sites.
eligible_projects_description: Development or renovation, Land acquisition, Combination of acquisition and development or renovation
administrative_sub: The National Park Service, U.S. Department of Interior
match_requirement_description: Applicants must provide a minimum of 10 percent of the total cost of a project in the form of a local contribution, not from a state or federal source.
funding_limitation_description: Grant requests must be between $25,000 and $500,000 for each application

funding_program: LWCF Outdoor Recreation Legacy Partnership Program
administrative_organization: Washington State Recreation and Conservation Office
program_description: Funding supports acquisition, development and renovation for public outdoor recreation and funds may be used for open space, forest, wildlife areas, beaches, and water access sites.
eligible_projects_description: Development or renovation, Land acquisition, Combination of acquisition and development or renovation
administrative_sub: The National Park Service, U.S. Department of Interior
match_requirement_description: Projects must be cost- shared with non-federal funds at a minimum ratio of 1:1. Matching funds may be derived from state, local, non-governmental, or private sources in the form of cash or in-kind contributions of land, services, materials, etc.
funding_limitation_description: Grant requests must be between $250,000 and $720,323 for each application
additional_application: Application dates are estimates at this time, pending publication of federal Notice of Funding Opportunity.
supplemental_information: Projects must be located within or serve jurisdictions with a population of 50,000 or more (2010 Census) and consist of a densely settled area. Projects also should be in or directly accessible to neighborhoods or communities that are underserved in terms of parks and recreation resources, and where there are significant populations of people who are economically disadvantaged.

funding_program: No Child Left Inside Tier 1
administrative_organization: Washington State Recreation and Conservation Office
program_description: Grant funds are available for outdoor environmental, ecological, agricultural, or other natural resource-based education and recreation programs serving youth.
eligible_projects_description: Youth outdoor education and recreation
administrative_sub: Washington State Parks and Recreation Commission
match_requirement_description: Although match is not required, applicants are strongly encouraged to provide matching resources to demonstrate a local commitment to the project and to make funds available to more projects. Project scores are weighted to reward projects that include matching shares.
funding_limitation_description: $5,000-$35,000 per project
additional_application: Application dates are estimates at this time
supplemental_information: The No Child Left Inside Grant Program is a WA State Parks and Recreation Commission grant program administered and managed by the Recreation and Conservation Office

match_requirement_description: Exceptions: Match may be reduced for communities in need, underserved populations, counties in need, or communities providing facilities in federal disaster areas.

additional_application: Application dates are estimates at this time
supplemental_information: The No Child Left Inside Grant Program is a WA State Parks and Recreation Commission grant program administered and managed by the Recreation and Conservation Office

funding_program: Washington Wildlife and Recreation Program - Forestland Preservation Category
administrative_organization: Washington State Recreation and Conservation Office
program_description: Funding supports acquisition and restoration of forestlands.
eligible_projects_description:
Acquisition of property rights through a conservation easement,
Combination of acquisition and habitat enhancement or restoration.
match_requirement_description:
Cities, Counties, and Nonprofit Conservancies
By statute, cities, counties, and nonprofit nature conservancies must contribute matching resources at least equal to the amount of the grant requested. Applicants must provide a minimum of 10 percent of the total cost of a project in the form of a local contribution, not from a state or federal source.                                   The State Conservation Commission is not required to provide a matching share.
funding_limitation_description: The maximum grant request can be $350,000. There is no minimum grant amount. Habitat enhancement or restoration activities must be less than 50 percent of the acquisition cost of the project including any in-kind contribution by any party

funding_program: National Coastal Wetlands Conservation Grant Program (USFWS)
administrative_organization: U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service
program_description: The National Coastal Wetlands Conservation Grant Program annually provides grants of up to $1 million to coastal and Grant Lakes states, as well as U.S. Territories to protect, restore and enhance coastal wetland ecosystems and associated uplands.  The grants are funded through the Sport Fish Restoration and Boating Trust Fund, which is supported by excise taxes on fishing equipment an motorboat fuel.
eligible_projects_description: The USFWS  awards habitat restoration and/or acquisition grants of up to $1 million to states based on a national competition.  While awards are made to state agencies, NGOs, Tribes, and Local entities can be sub-recipients of a grant.
administrative_sub: USFWS Wildlife Sport Fish and Restoration, Region 1, Portland Oregon.
match_requirement_description: Minimum 25% non-federal match with additional points awarded for increased match.
funding_limitation_description: $1M maximum federal award.
additional_application: Non-state entities should contact Heather Kapust at hkap461@ecy.wa.gov.  State agencies should contact rich_carlson@fws.gov
